Nope, it's not.  I have a copy of the ant-1.6.1 JAR on the classpath
was p=
assing in.  I removed it from the classpath (but not the build
directory) b=
ut it didn't help.  It seems to add it back in.  I ran
ant with the -v flag=
.  The first CLASSPATH looks good.  It is what I
set with <classpath ...> i=
n the junit task, and I have excluded the
old ant libraries we have in the =
application.  The second
CLASSPATH is much longer, and contains the old ant=
-1.6.1
library I have in my build directory.  Can anyone tell me
where this=
 second classpath is coming from? (I snipped the
actually classpaths from t=
he output because they were huge)

(BTW, I found a work-around - I can't re=
move the ant 1.6 JAR
entirely but I can upgrade to 1.6.5 which seems compat=
able
with 1.7.  But I would still like to know where this
second classpath =
comes from)
